headline: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez reportedly threatens to primary Democrats who vote with Republicans
subHeadline: Extreme Democrats divide party as progressives reportedly put moderates on notice; reaction and analysis on 'The Five.'

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, HOST
utterances.sentences: Hello. I am Dana Perino with Kennedy, Marie Harf, Jesse Watters and Greg Gutfeld. It's 5 o'clock in New York City on this Friday. This is “The Five.” Reports of a divide inside the Democratic Party. Moderates now are facing threats and political retribution if they work with Republicans. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi reportedly scolding more than two dozen Democrats who broke rank to support a Republican amendment in a gun control bill this week.  Congresswoman Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez take it a step further by threatening to put those Democrats on a list for a primary challenge if they vote with the GOP in the future.  This is very interesting because how did they win in the midterms, Greg? It wasn't necessarily the left. It was in those moderate swing districts where they have to vote as the constituents want.

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, HOST
utterances.sentences: I like how you asked me that question --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And then answered it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: -- and then you answered it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Jesse guided that. It's called reading the weakness.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Fantastic, you know. I need to rest my brain after beating Jesse yesterday on Tucker.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, HOST
utterances.sentences: Was it that hard?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Good point.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: How many times will it come up today?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It will come up every segment. OK. This strategy, to your point, mistakenly gives the power to the very people that they are trying to punish. Suddenly moderates and kind of independent minds have like the power of 10 of their peers. Like think about like --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes. They're like the freedom caucus now.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Think about like, what's his name, Rand Paul. Every time there has to be a vote everybody has to go to Rand Paul. They all have to run Rand Paul and see, Rand, would do you this, would you do that. And also, remember Susan Collins with the Kavanaugh thing?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's great to be that person. The person everybody has to wonder and worry about. I love stalemates. One of the great things about your parents fighting is that they overlook the stuff you're doing, you know. You could stay out later and they don't notice and they look in their cabinet every bottle got slightly less.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You thought a lot of that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. No, not as much as I would have liked. But, so, what I mean is, less work gets done in the government in stalemates. Stalemates -- it's kind of its form of limited government. Even though they take --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Right. They're not doing anything. Usually the stock market is happier too.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: When the government is not doing anything. Wouldn't you liked to have been a fly on the wall at this meeting, Jesse?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes. Definitely. Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Let's be honest here. There is a statistic in sports called plus or minus.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes, it's hard.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It measures the player's impact on the games when they are on the bench and when they're on the field --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: -- and how the other team is scoring on the opposing player.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Sportsplaining.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Did I just mansplain?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, you did.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But I welcome it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK, good. But I thought you read it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Plus or minus, I do mean it. Plus or minus.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: AOC if you look at its Republicans are scoring so many points because of AOC. If you think about the green new deal, socialism, abolish ICE, and then being OK illegal immigrants crossing the border to go buy guns and then not telling anybody that the illegals are trying to buy guns. That is so crazy. If the Democrats lose the House in 2020, there are going to be Democrats pointing their finger at AOC. And on top of that she wants to create a civil war? This is like, she is like the Steve Bannon of the left now? Remember what happened with the Tea Party. You get some good candidates like Rubio or a Cruz and then you get Aikens (Ph) and you get some crazy people.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Christine O'Donnell.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Christina the witch.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I am not a witch. I'm you.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Right. But you know, I love when Democrats fight each other. I just sit back and relax and --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: To Jesse's point, take a look at this poll, Kennedy. This was in the Wall Street Journal, a question about Medicare for all. So, in November 2018 when the election is happening, there was about 30 percent support. Where is it today? Twelve percent.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's a hell of a chart, Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: What do you think about that chart?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I think it's a great chart.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Thank you so much.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Excellent chart.

utterances.speaker: LISA KENNEDY MONTGOMERY, HOST
utterances.sentences: I mean --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: OK. Because we are talking about the issues rather than just about personalities.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: That's fantastic. But I think the problem with progressives is they feel the cult of personality will sell the idea. The problem is, you know, voters are more tuned-in than they have been in the past because everyone is talking about politics nowadays. One of my bosses pointed out that this is the new water cooler. It used to be the Kardashians and now it's President Trump and Congress.  And so, people go one step further on a lot of issues and they go, wait a second. What does this cost? And that's how, you know, and Marie and I have talked about this a lot. Moderate Democrats who have made inroads in the party in critical parts of the country and Nancy Pelosi and AOC, a brand- new freshman congresswoman is telling them they have to vote in lockstep.  Do you think that's going to be popular with their purple constituencies back home? No way! If they throw off the blob and show some independence, they are more electable. And if I want this job for a long time, and by the way I don't know who would want this job is. If you've people telling you if you don't vote a certain way, if you show any independence or logic at all you are going on a list? That's a horrible job.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's right. And Congresswoman Ocasio-Cortez with her list, apparently, Congresswoman Torres Small also a freshman, she won in New Mexico.

utterances.speaker: MARIE HARF, RADIO CO-HOST
utterances.sentences: New Mexico, right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And it was a very close race, it's right there on the border and apparently, she stood up in the meeting, Marie and she said you don't know how hard it is --

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- to actually run in a district where it's hard. I mean, obviously she, AOC beat the incumbent Democrat.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: In a very liberal --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But she didn't have to run in a very tough race.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: And I think Democrats are seeing a little bit of what the Republicans went through and they're still seeing it. Right. You have a very hard-core right-wing folks threatening to primary Republicans that's why so many moderate Republicans didn't run in 2018.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's true.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: Because they didn't want to get that inter-party primary. Look, these members who won in 2018 the moderate Democrats I do not think they are going to fall lockstep in line with AOC and I don't think AOC supporting primary challengers in these districts will actually work. If we look at these moderate districts or moderate states in 2018 the Democrats that won the primaries were moderates.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: They beat much progressive. Look at Virginia in the governor's race, for example. Tom Perriello a really progressive, he was beat was Ralph Northam.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: He lost. Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: He lost. So, I think that --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I bet you wish the other guy had won.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: Not actually. You mean Ed Gillespie?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: No, I don't wish that. But that's actually been an interesting discussion, Jesse. But, no. I think that AOC is very good at getting people to talk about her. The question that will face voters is who has done something for you? And the moderate Democrats I think have plans to say here is what I voted on that would have benefitted you.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: Here's how I've tried to help you. And she is really, I mean, she is getting so much grief from inside the party for threatening the primary people when she's not done anything yet in Congress.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: Can I add something to that very quickly?

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: Sure.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: Because if we're talking about moderate Democrats, they are the ones who are coming up with ideas to push forward an agenda which is the opposite of what Democratic leadership is doing especially in the House. They don't have ideas. They have resistance. And even though Nancy Pelosi --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Let me grab this other topic here because there is another example of liberal outrage. Joe Biden forced to apologize after making this statement about Mike Pence.

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN, FORMER VICE PRESIDENT
utterances.sentences: The fact of the matter is, just followed on by a guy who is a decent guy, our vice president who stood before this group of allies and leaders and said I am here on behalf of President Trump. And there was dead silence.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: After receiving tons of backlash for calling Pence a decent guy, Biden backtracked tweeting in part, quote, "there is nothing decent about being anti-LGBTQ rights and that includes the vice president." So, Greg, you can't even like say someone is a nice guy even if you disagree with him?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You can believe that Pence is incorrect in his beliefs and still see Biden as a really week person because he didn't change his mind. He folded to a mob on social media. I mean, if he gets that easily spooked --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: -- which is the opposite of being a leader, how is he going to handle the Twitter mob or even Trump in a debate? I mean, if you fold that quickly.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Good point.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Joe should have said, you know what? Pence was where I was 15 years ago. And do I dislike who I was 15 years ago? No, I thought he was a pretty good guy, I still think he is a pretty good guy. It's also interesting how one religion gets the shaft a lot on this but another religion doesn't.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: What do you make of that in terms of, I think that's a really good point. If Joe Biden had said look, a leadership position, if the number two issue in the country is worry about polarization --

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- is a way for him to deal with it to be a leader that says, actually, you know what, we can all do this, we can just -- we're all Americans.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes. He caved to the resistance. You know my motto, Dana?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: What?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Never apologize. Because it makes you look weak and soft.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: The art of the Jesse.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: In 2020, -- it has, and in 2020, it's going to be the Democrats will apologize for everything and Trump who apologizes for nothing. So it's going to be a great clash. And to Greg's point, Joe Biden was an indecent man just five years ago or 10 years ago when he the same position on traditional marriage. It doesn't make you anti-LGBTQ. Do I have that right?

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: Yes, you got it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: If you are against traditional marriage. You can be Christian and not hate gay people like they are trying to smear Pence's. And didn't the Trump administration just push for a worldwide decriminalization of homosexuality? He doesn't get any credit there.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Marie?

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: I think what this lesson tells us is that what we are seeing in many of these primary states out on the road now that Kennedy are talking to voters, is that voters care about a very different set of things than the online Twitter mob. And so, if people running in this primary --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It's so true.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: -- want to reach primary voters they cannot suck up their time and energy doing what Greg says, getting tied into the mob and responding to everything because when you look at issues even like Elizabeth Warren and the Native American issue. Voters are not asking her about it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: This just show, and you know what, you have a good perspective because you're not on Twitter.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: I am not on Twitter.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And I admire that so much. Kennedy, last word.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: No. I think Greg and Marie have it absolutely right. You know, Greg is right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Whoa, whoa, whoa! I said something coherent.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: Yes, you know what?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Never apologize.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: This segment is about winners. If you had won last time --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Ouch.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: You would have gotten shootouts. You cannot fold to the mob. And you cannot anticipate them and you also cannot pacify them. So, don't even try. And this election is going to be very different than 2016. It's not just going to be acrimonious. Democrats have to decide, do they want a cheap pale impression of President Trump and you know, to do this kind of thing and sling the kind of insults that they see?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: Or do they want someone who is actually strong and can lead the country. Because sometimes being strong means saying, you know what?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: I'm not going to -- I'm not going to talk about identity politics every time I open my mouth. Because, again, you are not talking to the people who are going to --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And just blaze (ph) the trail. All right. When it comes to investigating President Trump Democrats are just getting started. What they are planning, next.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: After three days of Michael Cohen's testimony and still no evidence of Russian collusion, Democrats have a backup plan to try to take Trump down. Investigate everybody. Lawmakers are promising to unleash a slew of new investigations into the president, the White House and the Trump organization. This includes a growing list of potential witnesses. And Democrats say they are just getting started.

utterances.speaker: SEN. ELIJAH CUMMINGS, D-MD
utterances.sentences: We've got about five committees that are looking at different aspects of the Trump administration.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: There are at least four or five areas where there is credible evidence that the president committed very serious crimes.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: The Trump people thought that they could get aware with anything. And we're bringing some of this to light now.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: The American people deserve to know whether Donald Trump is functionally a president or an organized crime boss.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I think we are moving into territory that is very perilous for the president and cannot be ignored by the Congress.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right, Marie, listen to these examples of what they want to investigate. How Trump humiliated Sessions.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's not OK.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: How he called --

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: I can give you the answer.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I have many more. How he called the press the enemy of the people. How he railed against the ninth circuit. They want to investigate his company. His foundation, his charity and his family members and get his tax returns. I mean, they are investigating a person, not actual events.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: Oversight is a tough thing. I know when you get to be in the majority and the people who put you there --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I think they are nearsighted.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: -- in part because they wanted more oversight. Look, all of those entities you mentioned are already under investigation whether it's the Southern District of New York or other folks. Bob Mueller when it comes to Russia and obstruction of justice. These are all under investigation. There are committees tasked with oversight. And I think that's the appropriate thing to do. I also think Democrats have to at the same time put forward a policy agenda. Next week they'll be voting on their bill that tries to perform how we do campaigns some of the campaign finance issues.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: No one cares about that.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: Well, I actually do and I think a lot of voters do.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: No. They care about healthcare and education and --

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: Well, they also have healthcare bills they are putting forward.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: And other policy agenda they are putting forward.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: They got a swing at the Obamacare and they failed. Kennedy --

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: We are not the ones who failed to repeal and replace after running on that for 10 years.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: No, Obamacare was just a failure. Kennedy --

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: No. Actually, it's more popular than the Trump tax cuts today.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: When the Republicans were in charge of oversight, they actually investigated real events.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: I'm sorry. What?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Like the IRS targeting scandal, fast and furious, Benghazi, the V.A. scandals. People actually died then and people's constitutional rights were violated. It just seems like they are just going after one guy this time.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: Yes, innocent Americans. You know, when you're talking about Benghazi and you're talking about the V.A. scandal we still don't have satisfactory answers to some of those queries. My advice for Democrats is if the president did something wrong, figure out what it is and advance. Instead of launching a thousand ships, you know, figure out three or four. And instead of throwing so much spaghetti at the wall because at some point you are going to have an empty plate and people are going to be hungry.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I'm hungry right now just talking about pasta. Do you think there are any legitimate oversight inquiries that the Democrats have that you say that, you know, that's fine?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Out of the list that you said like too vague. I think they are perhaps like I think on the -- they are going to definitely try on the point that I was making yesterday about when AOC asked about the money laundering and the insurance fraud. And I think that that was like very specific and smart, like the way that she laid that out. I don't know if it goes that way.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Please.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: What?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Anyway, Elijah --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Real estate evaluation driving me crazy.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's not what it was about.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: How many homes do you have, Greg?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Elijah Cummings made a -- he was very s offended the other day during the hearing --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- when all of these Republicans were y saying this is the first hearing we're having and that's outrageous. And he says, no, that's not the case.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: We actually did the very first thing they did was on prescription drug prices, which was the number one issue, right? Healthcare. The second is one was about voting rights. They actually there are a lot of state legislatures that trying to change the laws right now. So, we should all be paying attention to that. So, if they want to keep the House and have a chance of bringing back the Senate, they are going to have to have a record to run on. And running on going after the president and headlines on, you know, other cable stations are probably not going to help.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Greg, I'm going to you last since you beat me last night, so go right ahead.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Beat you like a drum. A weak, small drum. Anyway, a pathetic small drum. Is there any limit to investigations? So that's the scary part. It's like there is nobody there saying hold on. Deep breath. let's take on -- it's like they are shot gunning beer right now at the beach.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I'm switching parties.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. They are investigating into why they don't like somebody.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's what this is about. So, the oversight is getting a little overdone. And they are spending money, really, our money on therapy. If you think about it all of this is a direct result obviously of 2016. Trump won. So, every investigation and anti-Trump story is kind of an ointment for that wound. But the problem is a lot of these ointments aren't working. Kavanaugh, Covington, Smollett, the BuzzFeed bombshell, Cohen. These are supposed to be the (Inaudible) that are designed to sue Jim Acosta and people like him. But it's so bad that it's not working. You know what it is. It's like if you comparing drugs that are long lasting these kinds of moments, they're like crack where last about 15 minutes. It's not a really long high.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: So, you are saying if you have Trump derangement syndrome the doctor will prescribe harsh oversight?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, exactly.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's the only thing that's going to make --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I also think that it is a backlash from 2014 and '15 and the Benghazi hearings.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And a lot of career staff who were there on the Hill --

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: They've been waiting for it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes. This is -- yes.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: Absolutely right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: This is the first time they've had the gavel back so they are going to try to go for it.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: These are also real --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: People actually died in Benghazi.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: -- criminal allegations of wrongdoing though by the president and senior members of the administration.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Trump was mean to Sessions?

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: That's right. Dana is right. Stop spreading it so thin.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: Right. But --

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: What happens when you spread pizza across too thin? It falls apart.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Real food analogies.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, it's not time.

utterances.speaker: HARF
utterances.sentences: These are real allegations of wrongdoing.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right. Wait until you hear how one media outlet is trying to excuse Jussie Smollett's hate crime hoax, next.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: All right. A Hollywood reporter apparently making new excuses for Jussie Smollett. The magazine suggesting the stress of fame could be the reason the "Empire" actor allegedly faked the hate crime saying, quote, "Did the pressures of childhood fame or a struggling music career play a role in causing him to concoct what police are now deeming an elaborate hoax?" Greg, I will go to you first because you have covered media and celebrities for a long time.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That I have.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Like he knows stress.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I do. I make -- by the way, that's true. There is nobody more stressful -- than stressed out than I am. And I've never faked a hate crime.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes. You should be on a hate --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I should be doing fake hate crimes up and down Fifth Avenue the way I am. Here's -- you know, the whole cover of this they've been putting him on the cover. This industry I think is ashamed. And they can't accept how their delusion made them vulnerable to a hoaxer with the explosion of hate crime media attention? There is no immune system.
